text: The Hive Piscine was the most intense month of my life. 12 hours a day coding, but the community is amazing. It's truly peer-to-peer, no teachers telling you what to do. If you survive the pool, the main curriculum gives you freedom.
title: Hive Helsinki: Intense but rewarding

text: It's free, which is incredible for Finland. But be warned, the 'no teachers' style isn't for everyone. You need to be very self-disciplined.
title: Hive Helsinki: Great model if you are self-driven

text: Integrify helped me switch careers from sales to tech in 6 months. The instruction quality is high and they really push you to get hired. They have good connections with Finnish tech companies.
title: Integrify: Landed a job in 2 months!

text: Expensive if you look at the raw price (~12k), but the deal is you only pay if you get a job. Fair trade. The pace is fast, we covered React, Node, and TypeScript very quickly.
title: Integrify: Fast paced professional training

text: Aalto is world-class. The CS department is huge and the startup sauna atmosphere is unique in Europe. It's more theoretical than a bootcamp, obviously, but gives you a solid foundation for life.
title: Aalto University: Top tier university experience

text: Full Stack Open is the best free resource on the internet, period. I did it at my own pace while working. It's challenging and updated every year. Highly recommend for learning modern React.
title: Full Stack Open: Best free course available

text: Business College Helsinki is a vocational school, so it's very practical. Good teachers, free for residents. The game dev track is pretty cool.
title: Business College Helsinki: Practical and free

text: 12 weeks of hell (in a good way). AW Academy crams huge amounts of info. You are guaranteed a job, but you are bound to their contract for 2 years. Read the fine print.
title: AW Academy: Intensive and guaranteed job, but strings attached

text: Tampere is an amazing city for students (Teekkari culture!). The computer science program is very high quality, especially if you like signal processing.
title: Tampere University: Great student culture

text: Oulu is cold in winter but the university is warm. Excellent research facilities for 6G and AI. Very affordable living.
title: University of Oulu: Top research in the North

text: LUT has a super strong community spirit. The 'Skinnarila spirit' is real. The software engineering courses are modern and industry-relevant.
title: LUT University: Best community spirit

text: Studying at Myllypuro campus is nice, it's brand new. Metropolia focuses on doing things, not just reading books. Good for getting job skills.
title: Metropolia: Brand new campus

text: Haaga-Helia's BIT program is the standard for getting into IT business in Helsinki. Lots of networking events.
title: Haaga-Helia: Networking goldmine

text: Good online option if you can't move to Helsinki. Flexible schedule, but you need to be self-motivated.
title: Code Labs Academy: Flexible online option

text: The software developer line at Careeria Tikkurila is very hands-on. We use real tools like Visual Studio and Unity. It's relaxed but you learn a lot.
title: Careeria: Practical coding studies
